messages.message:
Brian
Can you troll with positivity?
With what

Brian
You seem to like the word troll, can we start there?
I am not green I promise
Posting inane tripe at atheists being

Brian
I regard you as highly intelligent.  I knew there was something we have in common and I used it to gain your understandings.  What is important to you?
You don't even know me to think of me as intelligent...do you find such sycophantic activities work?

Brian
Wow, you are blowing my mind right now.  What advantage do I have to talk to you?
Wow...you're a disappointment

Brian
That's why my dad says.
*what
You seem to be bereft of intelligent thought....I am entertaining myself on the way to unfriending you

Brian
So you friended me just to unfriend me?  Are you trying to prove you are better than me?  This is really intriguing to me.  I'll have to modify my test.

No...I have a couple thousand "friends" on fb....I don't know how it came to be...you like to bait people...is that for entertainment purposes, or is it just that you have nothing else to do with your brain or your time?

Brian
I need a job.  I appreciate you asking.    I want to start enabling people to do more.  And I found something we have in common to figure out how.
What is it we have in common?

Brian
Doubt of Gods existence.
I don't have a doubt

Brian
So you must be all knowing!  Congratulations!

Not at all...
If you can find a deity that has it all together then I could be wrong but currently there is no documentation for any such being....
Just made up drivel from people trying to control others

Brian
My deity is called the mindfulness of being. I am not the second coming, I am the first. This is all happening in reverse!

Ahhh
And what does your deity do for you?

Brian
Peace of mind makes everything easier to cope with.  This is where the equanimity and Upekkha come in.

Brian
What do you do Charles?  I need a job.

Where are you?
I'm in collections

Brian
Phoenix, willing to relocate.  Have you heard of ALPR?  What kind of collections exactly? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automatic_number_plate_recognition
Automatic number plate recognition - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Automatic number plate recognition (ANPR; see also other names below) is a technology that uses optical character recognition on images to read vehicle registration plates. It can use existing closed-circuit television, road-rule enforcement cameras, or cameras specifically designed for the task. AN...
en.wikipedia.org

I work for a collection company that deals with commercial, financial stuff
Etc
Why do you ask about ANPR... sounds like the car version of face recognition

Brian
Yeah exactly!  I was just providing some data.  I thought it would be cool to apply that software to car collections.  When someone defaults we can find them more efficiently now.  Is there some way software could help you prioritize collections?

We have software....and credit score ratings...
It could work on stolen vehicles too

Brian
Credit scores don't tell the whole story, huge flaws.
Good idea, I didn't think about the stolen part!
Well u get a name part of an address and an amount owing....sometimes u get lots of data sometimes not

Brian
Do you share that with contractors?  Not that I want to be a contractor, just curious about the process.

We have privacy laws in Canada
Personal Information Privacy and Electronic Data Act...PIPEDA

Brian
I am really into policy.  I've read HIPAA and PCI DSS and CFR 21 Part 11.
If u were married and your spouse owed $50 I couldn't talk to you about it without their permission

Brian
Oh that makes sense
In Arizona we can buy any persons debt.  Isn't that messed up?

Even if you wanted to pay it off without them knowing
We can do that here too...better commission

Brian
brilliant!
Now I am learning.
Wow.  This is insightful, a complete 180 from how we started.
Part of my job is skip tracing ....you get to see some fucked up stories

Brian
wow, what is that?  how do you do it?  skip tracing?
This is some field ops stuff right here.
We,have tools...google Facebook and proprietary technology

Brian
Like military grade?
I wont pressure, I know you can't talk about it.

I tracked down a lady in jail....she had bitten another persons nose off...a few yrs earlier she teaching mentally challenged people to provide blow jobs to taxi cab operators..convicted of human trafficking....I was trying to collect 60-70 from her...wrote it off

Brian
holy shit.. that will have to sink in for a minute.
Lol...a few murders involving love triangles

Brian
As a society we need to have a conversation about how we treat crazy people.  I just went to 55 hours of therapy last week.
Bikers in jail for murder, bribery , drugs etc

Brian
That is scary.
Had to call somebody with terminal cancer on Friday who owes $120 or so

Brian
Wow.  We need to prioritize better.
Get the people taking advantage of it, not the ones already suffering.
They incurred a legitimate debt

Brian
Legitimate or imposed by a substandard society?

So you think it's ok to absolve them from the responsibility of their actions?
So before I die I should max out my credit limits and go to town buying things for people new car tv etc? .... This person had a contractual agreement for something they defaulted on

Brian
Yes exactly.  Fuck banks.

Do if you lent somebody 10,000 and they turned around and said I'm sick so I can't pay ... Your cool with goring out that money?
Fucking auto corrupt

Brian
I lent someone risky 7k and they paid me back.  How do I prove they weren't going to pay me back?

What if they didn't
A risk you take lending them money
Are used to evict people they said I wasn't nice but if you had a house and rented a basement apartment and they didn't pay rent and destroyed the place you would want me

Brian
Oh yeah.  That makes sense, there is a lesser to evil.  That sounds like humanity, we are the lesser of two evils.  Humanity is the opposite of nothingness and lack of existence.
lack of non-existence
I believe in personal responsibility for ones actions .... Sometimes the consequences aren't warm and fuzzy .... But these people know this before they enter into the agreement

Brian
But do they really know?  Really?  Does anyone take their entire budget to the bank with them and see how much less groceries they will be able to buy when they buy a car instead?  They trust banks the same way we trust doctors.  Loans are just like prescription drugs.
You get a credit card and then buy stuff you don't need with money you don't have...who is the victim? I think it's the person who extended the credit

Brian
I think it is the person thinking they need something they dont.
So you default on your credit card and your the victim?

Brian
Defaulting is a scapegoat.
It's a way out.  Kind of.  In that case you are a burden on society.
You have me there.
My uncle bought an investment property rented it to a family who ended up stopped paying rent ...I sue the for eviction am I the bad guy or the hero

Brian
Dang dude, you are really good at this!
Thank you 
I guess in the best case scenario some insurance or the state would get the renters their money until they can figure out where the rent money went.

There is always more than one side to a story....sometimes more than two, or three
How do you pay rent when you are unemployed and you spouse was in an accident...sometime they don't pay because they can't sometimes they're just dickwads

Brian
Great point.  That is so sad.  Can't we factor that into the algorithm that figures out who to go after next?  Why does it seem so linear?
There is a debt...sometimes it seems more legit than other times..I have to collect from stuff that seems not so nice but they have signed stupid contracts

Brian
Makes sense.

It's not my call...not all business people are nice, not are all crooks
Girlfriend is here now...have a nice night

Brian
So there is an escalation process and research process?  At least thats what I have gained.  I just wonder how they prioritize.  Wouldn't it be more effective to go after the biggest spenders first?
Yeah you too. Thank you!

Yeah they send 500 files or a thousand or 45
12.10 accounts aren't as high on the list as989.46
But they all, have to be dealt with

Brian
makes sense.

We act as first contact as well as third party and sometimes buy debt....each is its own department
Each their own processes

Brian
I still need a job.    At least I wont be biased anymore, I have a shoelace in the door at Wells Fargo.
We will always be biased
Brian
So you gave up on me as a guinea pig?

Brian
Haha!  Just didn't want to take up anymore of your time.  It isn't all that important.  I gained a ton by talking about responsibility.  I recently paid off a ton of debt, but I was seriously considering bankruptcy.  I don't want to be a detriment to others, and our conversation helped me explain why.

Brian
Not trying to convert anyone, just trying to get them to justify themselves, that is more important 
Tricky tricky...

Brian
How are you?
I'm ok and you?

Brian
Excellent, I've started revamping a meditation site and I will be paid decently for my work.  This is a great step since two weeks ago.
Or a month ago since we last spoke.
Has been a while....you still messing with those folks on the fb page?

Brian
Focusing less on answering Godly questions and more on distracting them from politics.  I want to write a robot to manage my online presence.
Lol

Brian

This is interesting: http://www.inquisitr.com/1504964/jesus-never-existed/
Jesus Never Existed Says New Report That Finds No Mention Of Christ In 126 Historical Texts
Jesus was a made-up character says a new study of 126 tests written around the time Jesus supposedly lived, but include no mention of a historical Christ.
inquisitr.com

Yeah I've rad a bunch of that...
Rad ..read

Brian
It makes me wonder, if the story of Jesus is a lie, then the purpose of the story is to affect how people behave, not so much what they believe.
Which makes me think, if the purpose is to help us behave better, despite everything we've done wrong, it is the outcome that matters not the intention.  This aligns with Theravada.

Religion is all about control...https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codex_Sinaiticus
Codex Sinaiticus - Wikipedia
Codex Sinaiticus (Modern Greek: Σιναϊτικός Κώδικας, Hebrew: קודקס סינאיטיקוס‎‎; Shelfmarks and references: London, Brit. Libr., Additional Manuscripts 43725; Gregory-Aland nº א [Aleph] or 01, [Soden δ 2]) or "Sinai Bible" is one of the four great uncial codices, an ancient, handwritten copy of the G...
en.wikipedia.org
I'm more a fan of the Tao te ching

Brian
Is that intention or outcome?
I hear this all the time "well I meant well"
If you do something you think is nice and it turns out horrible....

Brian
There is also a strong correlation with the torah.  Doesn't matter what you meant for, only what actually happens.
My grandmother use to say the road to hell is paved with good intentions

Brian
So intention doesn't matter, only outcome.
I'll have to file that under Philosophy.

It can be a mitigating factor but nit always an absolution
You know I was trying to help the old lady across the street...it's not my fault she got run over...

Brian
dang.
Mindfulness?
If you pray to God you both make it alive will you?
There is no god and no point to prayer

Brian
If you meditate to Buddha?
In the end it doesn't matter because everything will happen anyways.

The earth is filled with a billion people who prayed to one god or another....
Why meditate to a dead man he will provide no answers...thoughtful, or thought free introspection might

Brian
So should you help the old lady or not?

That requires me to impose my will upon her....maybe she doesn't want help
Maybe she's just hanging out on the corner watching life moving

Brian
But you can determine that easily beforehand.
Maybe this comes down to who we place blame on.  Which is a common theme is our justice system.
So I saw a guy trying to unload a metal file folder cabinet he had his 13 yr old daughter helping...he looked like he needed help so I asked..he did I helped

Brian
So by asking questions you can always make the right decision?
Of course not

I was born I will die...I try to enjoy this life and part of that is helping out when I can...it's not my job to correct people, instruct them or otherwise tell them what to do...I believe they can do what they want with their own lives until it comes into conflict with and then I usually take my side because I don't want others imposing on me

Brian
I feel like that related to Jesus.
*relates

Except there is no proof he existed
Or Confucius

Brian
So you don't believe the bible because its not the place of the bible to tell people what to do, just like it is not your place to tell people what to do.

I believe the bible is a series of stories stolen from preceding cultures and many of them are wrong or antiquated....there is a lot of nastiness in 'the good book'
It is fiction that has fucked humanity for way too long

Brian
So what is the point?
Of what?

Brian
What if you could influence people without telling them what to do?

I can....
The wise man practices what he preaches then preaches what he practices

Brian
What do you preach?
Nothing

Brian
What do you practice?

Living my life
I'm going to die one day I just hope that I have few regrets

Brian
Why don't you care about anyone else?
When did I say that?

Brian
You didn't, I just want you to justify yourself
I don't have...I am and one day I won't be

Brian
But don't you want others to be the best version of themselves?
I didn't ask to be born

Brian
Should I reproduce?

It's nit my job to decide what us the best version of somebody...it's their job
It's your decision not mine...I have,to the best of my knowledge, avoided it
What makes the best person? Who is to decide...I dated a nympho...she loved sex...should she be a hooker? Or should she take her phd in veterinary sciences and be a world class research scientist like she is...

What makes the best person? Who is to decide...I dated a nympho...she loved sex...should she be a hooker? Or should she take her phd in veterinary sciences and be a world class research scientist like she is...

Brian
hot
Without the education she probably would have made six figures dating rich men....who is to say one is right of wrong....it's her life nit mine

Brian
hmm, I have to think on this.
I've been talking to people trying to get them to talk about their ambitions, just so that they are more likely to achieve them.  Better use of time than politics on FB.  I might have to reprioritize.
It's their time...

Brian
I take it you know what tithing is.  But do you know you can tithe with things other than money.  Thing of your grandchildren (if you have grandchildren).
I don't have children

Brian
Think of what I could do with the insights you have given me in the last 20 minutes.

I don't believe I should give a bunch of clowns my resources
Lol insights in 20

Brian
Same thing as a job, you are giving someone your time in exchange for money, what is more important, money or time?
We all make tradeoffs.

You can accumulate lots of money....You cannot save time...you can only spend it...
I know lots of rich people, but we all end up the same way...

Brian
I think you can save time.  Have you every heard the phrase "ahead of your time"?  I heard it in a Woody Allen movie once.
Each second which passes is one second left in out life

Brian
It means I am ahead of everyone else's schedule, so I can sit around coming up with satirical jokes to make smart people laugh.
Less...

Brian
Time is relative.
Time is illusory

Brian
Prove it.
Thought I'd toss that one out there

Brian
  Glad you did.
Time is the only thing worth saving, if time is in fact relative.  I exchange my time for worldly things, and as long as my needs are met I can tithe with my time.

When you're having a good time there tends to be nit enough,and when it's bad it seems to go on too long...
You cannot save time you can only spend it....

Brian
So happiness is the only thing that matters, you can tithe with that too.

You can do things efficiently but you can't store it or save it
Happiness is not all that matters...food matters
What is it with you and tithes?
Having shelter in winter or a storm matters

Brian
I think if you tithe with love and happiness your ambition transcends time, therefore transcending death.

But your still dead...my friend bought 10acres of land on a small lake...to build his legacy...he/we built a 2,500sq ft cottage on it...it's his gift to his children, grandchildren etc...he will still be as dead as you or me in the end
What concern do you have after you die? Is it not the same as before you were born?

Brian
But he's put them in a better position for survival despite natural catastrophes
It's a cottage ....a beautiful one...but still it's just a thing

Brian
like you said, it's all about productivity (efficiency)
He's made smart decisions that allow his offspring to make smarter decisions.
What if they invent a cure for famine in that house?
Prove that it made no difference.

It's still a summer cottage in Muskoka...maybe it prevents them from finding it because they were water skiing instead of researching?
You can't prove future events
Maybe if somebody sat down and had a beer with hitler and he got dome shit off his chest he wouldn't have killed 6 million Jews...prove it"?

Brian
but if you kept track of which events specifically lead to success:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PQynVVwlcSE&app=desktop

How a mathematician dissects a coincidence
Can you unknot a twist of fate with logic? Vox's Phil Edwards asked mathematician Joseph Mazur about his book, Fluke, and one of its most incredible stories....
youtube.com

There is a reason hindsight is 20/20, and we haven't have the technology to record it until now.
We can prove there is no such thing as coincidence in this generation.

I accidentally ran into an old friend...that led to a conversation which resulted in me starting a business and making over a million in sales.....it's an opportunity, but action made it real...it was a coincidence that we ran into each other in the subway...but only on my action did anything result
2 minutes either way and I would not have seen him...it was coincidence we were on the same car and sat within 3 feet of each other

Brian
brilliant!  this is perfect opportunity to dissect this "coincidence"
Why was your friend on the subway?
He was going somewhere....as was I ...

Brian
Why didn't you meet there before?

Because we were in different places
If I had stopped at one coffe shop instead of another or not stopped at all then it wouldn't have happened...I can say the same thing for him....we were room mates fir a summer in university
And buddies throughout university
And accidentally ran into each other a decade later
And proceeded to hang out for 12-13 yrs
We've spoken twice in the last 12 years

Brian
To me it sounds like it was just a matter of time before you spoke about this business idea.

He's what you would consider to be highly successful and I was his 'confidente...we didn't see each other for a decade...We're inseparable for a dozen years and have spoken once or twice since 2005
My partner is very successful in standard terms I play the same role with her
We will be in NYC at the Smithsonian next month
She does a show there once a year

Brian
So do you believe in coincidence?

Usually in DC
Of course I do...is it directed I think not ....life happens
I use to run into people I knew everywhere I went...I have met and shaken hands with 100.000 people do I expect to run into people on the strangest places it doesn't make it supernatural or predetermined
It helps I have a good memory....

Brian
So do you believe in luck?
I believe that random occurrences...more often than not luck can be ascribed to hard work, persistence

Brian
"luck is preparation meets opportunity"

You play poker and you have one out...you hit? Is it luck or is it that 1/50 times it will happen
Yeah sometimes....it was coincidence I ran into John on the subway ...it was effort that we kept in touch and it was insight we recognized a common ground that I could develop a business around it

Brian
depends on who cares about winning the least, affects which order the cards are shuffled in.
Doesn't matter what care on the cards are shuffled the deck doesn't change

Brian
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0128442/
Rounders (1998)
Directed by John Dahl. With Matt Damon, Edward Norton, Gretchen Mol, John Malkovich. A young man is a reformed gambler who must return to playing big stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks.
imdb.com
I know the movie

Brian
So you are saying if the shuffler has nothing to lose, they will shuffle in the same way as someone who has everything to lose?

I'm suggesting that in many hands the dealer is not involved and once the cards are shuffled they play out the way they are
At casinos a dealer does it...they aren't involved

Brian
What if cards are shuffled by a computer, and the technological singularity has already happened?
It has already happened

Brian
Then you already know everything I know.
Once the cards are shuffled  they don't change positions

Brian
But who put them in that position?

They are randomized either well or not, but once they are shuffled and dealt they don't change positions
If you can shuffle them in a way favourable to you...it's cheating and nit luck..I know people who can stack decks...
Anyway I'm outa beer...I should take a break...

Brian
Haha, I've had a few too.  You know that computes don't really DO random right?
Lol they do what they are programmed to do ... nothing more or less

Brian
Right, but there is no such thing as random.  A random function in computation is based on an equation, and that equation has a seed of variance based on an atomic clock.

My buddy owns a bridge website ..I think he wrote a program to randomize cards... he's business partners with warren buffet and bill gates...it's still just a program and he's rich because of a card game
He also designed software to teach people how to play the cards
.... bridgebase online
Live and die ... enjoy in between...

Brian
https://www.random.org/randomness/
RANDOM.ORG - Introduction to Randomness and Random Numbers
This page explains why it's hard (and interesting) to get a computer to generate proper random numbers.
random.org
Escalation:
https://thestack.com/cloud/2016/10/18/met-office-accurately-predicts-winter-weather-a-year-in-advance/

Are you familiar with Malcolm gladwell?
Blink...

Brian
I've read probably 7/10 of his books

Cool
Another silly Canuck..sorta...

My girlfriend is making a bunch of these for Remembrance Day
Beaded poppies....

Brian
How much?

Brian
etsy page?

No she has a waiting list... she capped it at 12 .... no volume savings as each one takes the same amount of time
They are all hand made
She is a brilliant artisan

Brian
I agree.

Brian
amazing!

A dragonfly bracelet

A painting
